projects.title: Viewdeo
projects.description:
My first personal commercial Android application. Released end of November 2018.

Made a Free version and a Paid version, nearly making 2+ sales a day, without any marketing.

The Application helps a niche, where there is problems with Reddit's Video Media files, that do not download and share properly on Mobile.

The App can also download other media types like Gifs, Streamables, Gyfcat, Giphy just to name a few, where ever user desires.

The media can then easily be shared and VIEWed later as videos.

projects.title: Timester
projects.description:
My very first Android Application. The idea and art was from a friend.

 The idea was about a little hamster that runs on a wheel which "powers" the clock.

The hamster would also have cycles during the day, where it would take a lunch break, sleep, struggle to wake up, etc.

I'm now planning to make an Android WearOs version and an updated LWP version soon.

projects.title: Club 21
projects.description:
My first Mobile Application Game with socket server connection.

Great Dealing animations and a first Black Jack Game in South Africa.

The game was very popular on Mobile App Booklets (Before App stores).

projects.title: Pirate's Pearls
projects.description: My first Mobile Action Game, the game was a popular match 3 game from that time.

projects.title: Pharaoh's Fortune
projects.description:
Marketing Game for a new Casino, a Slot Machine where players could win actual prizes (Not Money).

Winners was determined Server-Side, but via Random Draw.

I used a blur effect from Photoshop to FAKE the perceived speed when the wheels spun.

This was in 2007 and I have never seen anyone else do this effect in this manner, which I was quite proud of.

projects.title: Pyramids of Treasure
projects.description:
Another slot machine game, based on the same engine I used before.

It was for another company and had more elaborate win combinations, also a Server-Side draw-to-win.

projects.title: Taxi Jam
projects.description:
Rush Hour game clone, but with a South African twist.

The vehicles even took damage when trying to pass an impassible car (block).

projects.title: Tetra Lift
projects.description:
A marketing campaign from Puma's shoes.

The idea was that the shoes were so light, they float.

We made a Tetris clone, where the blocks would float upwards, instead of dropping downwards.

The shoes were in the Tetris Blocks, which "made" them float.

projects.title: Fedhealth Medical
